title: Rata Harrison
text:
Rata Wiremu Harrison (3 January 1935 – 30 April 2013) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> player who represented <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a>.
He was the brother of fellow New Zealand international <a href="Billy%20Harrison%20%28rugby%20league%29">Billy Harrison</a>.
Playing career.
Harrison played for <a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a>. He played in two test matches for <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> in 1961, against <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a>.
On 13 August 1962, Harrison was part of the Auckland side who defeated <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> 46-13 at <a href="Carlaw%20Park">Carlaw Park</a>. This was the first televised rugby league match in New Zealand, as one hour of edited highlights were shown on AKTV2 that night and other regional channels showed the highlights the following week.
Harrison died on 30 April 2013.
